intro: Hieracium commixtum, commonly known as the mixed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with rough textures. Hieracium commixtum is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize new areas.
